translation.text: One who becomes Gurmukh understands.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: He rids himself of egotism, Maya and doubt.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੀ ਪਉੜੀ ਊਤਮ ਊਚੀ ਦਰਿ ਸਚੈ ਹਰਿ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਇਦਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: He ascends the sublime, exalted ladder of the Guru, and he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord at His True Door. ||7||

transliteration.text: gur kī paurī ūtam ūchī dar sachai har gun gāidā .7.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: The Gurmukh practices true self-control, and acts in excellence.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The Gurmukh obtains the gate of salvation.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਭਾਇ ਭਗਤਿ ਸਦਾ ਰੰਗਿ ਰਾਤਾ ਆਪੁ ਗਵਾਇ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Through loving devotion, he remains forever imbued with the Lord's Love; eradicating self-conceit, he merges in the Lord. ||8||

transliteration.text: bhāi bhagat sadā rang rātā āp gavāi samāidā .8.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: One who becomes Gurmukh examines his own mind, and instructs others.

translation.text: He is lovingly attuned to the True Name forever.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਜੋ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਸੋਈ ਕਰਸੀ ਜੋ ਸਚੇ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਇਦਾ ॥੯॥

translation.text: They act in harmony with the Mind of the True Lord. ||9||

transliteration.text: jō tis bhāvai sōī karasī jō sachē man bhāidā .9.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. translation.text: As it pleases His Will, He unites us with the True Guru.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਜਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਤਾ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾਏ ॥

translation.text: As it pleases His Will, He comes to dwell within the mind.

transliteration.text: jā tis bhāvai tā mann vasāē .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਆਪਣੈ ਭਾਣੈ ਸਦਾ ਰੰਗਿ ਰਾਤਾ ਭਾਣੈ ਮੰਨਿ ਵਸਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: As it pleases His Will, He imbues us with His Love; as it pleases His Will, He comes to dwell in the mind. ||10||

transliteration.text: āpanai bhānai sadā rang rātā bhānai mann vasāidā .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Those who act stubborn-mindedly are destroyed.

translation.text: Wearing all sorts of religious robes, they do not please the Lord.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਬਿਖਿਆ ਰਾਤੇ ਦੁਖੁ ਕਮਾਵਹਿ ਦੁਖੇ ਦੁਖਿ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: Tinged by corruption, they earn only pain; they are immersed in pain. ||11||

transliteration.text: bikhiā rātē dukh kamāvah dukhē dukh samāidā .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਮਰਣੁ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਜੋ ਸਮ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਣੈ ਸੋ ਮੇਰੇ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਭਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: One who looks alike upon death and birth, is pleasing to my God. ||12||

transliteration.text: maran jīvan jō sam kar jānai sō mērē prabh bhāidā .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: The Gurmukh, while remaining dead, is respected and approved.

translation.text: He realizes that coming and going are according to God's Will.

text: ਮਰੈ ਨ ਜੰਮੈ ਨਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਏ ਮਨ ਹੀ ਮਨਹਿ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: He does not die, he is not reborn, and he does not suffer in pain; his mind merges in the Mind of God. ||13||

transliteration.text: marai n janmai nā dukh pāē man hī manah samāidā .13.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Very fortunate are those who find the True Guru.

text: ਮਨੁ ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਫਿਰਿ ਮੈਲੁ ਨ ਲਾਗੈ ਦਰਿ ਸਚੈ ਸੋਭਾ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Their minds are immaculate, and they are never again stained with filth. They are honored at the Door of the True Court. ||14||

transliteration.text: man niramal phir mail n lāgai dar sachai sōbhā pāidā .14.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮਿ ਰਤੇ ਵੀਚਾਰੀ ਨਾਮੇ ਨਾਮਿ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੬॥੧॥੧੫॥

translation.text: O Nanak, those who contemplate the Naam are imbued with it. They merge in the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||16||1||15||

transliteration.text: nānak nām ratē vīchārī nāmē nām samāidā .16.1.15.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: Maaroo, Third Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: He Himself fashioned the Universe, through the Hukam of His Command.

text: ਆਪੇ ਨਿਆਉ ਕਰੇ ਸਭੁ ਸਾਚਾ ਸਾਚੇ ਸਾਚਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: The True Lord Himself administers all justice; through Truth, we merge in the True Lord. ||1||

transliteration.text: āpē niāu karē sabh sāchā sāchē sāch milāidā .1.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਬਦੈ ਭਸਮੈ ਕੀ ਢੇਰੀ ਖੇਹੂ ਖੇਹ ਰਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Without the Word of the Shabad, the body is reduced to a pile of ashes; in the end, dust mingles with dust. ||2||

transliteration.text: bin sabadai bhasamai kī dhērī khēhū khēh ralāidā .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗਾਵੈ ਸਦਾ ਗੁਣ ਸਾਚੇ ਮਿਲਿ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਮ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh sings the Glorious Praises of the True Lord forever; meeting his Beloved, he finds peace. ||3||

transliteration.text: guramukh gāvai sadā gun sāchē mil prītam sukh pāidā .3.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਕਾਇਆ ਹਰਿ ਮੰਦਰੁ ਹਰਿ ਆਪਿ ਸਵਾਰੇ ॥

translation.text: The body is the temple of the Lord; the Lord Himself embellishes it.

transliteration.text: kāiā har mandar har āp savārē .

translation.text: The Dear Lord dwells within it.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕੈ ਸਬਦਿ ਵਣਜਨਿ ਵਾਪਾਰੀ ਨਦਰੀ ਆਪਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the merchants trade, and in His Grace, the Lord merges them with Himself. ||4||

transliteration.text: gur kai sabad vanajan vāpārī nadarī āp milāidā .4.

translation.text: The Creator Himself acts, and inspires all to act; He Himself abides in the mind. ||5||

transliteration.text: āpē karē karāē karatā āpē mann vasāidā .5.
